comments.commentBody:
A snake oil salesman like Donald Trump can always get the gullible to buy his con by appealing to unjustified instincts that they are persecuted by Democrats, outsiders, and racial or ethnic minorities.

First, let's be clear, when they voted for Trump, they voted directly against their self interest. Will building a "Wall", a worthless expenditure of public monies, improve their lives or create jobs? No. Will it improve their children's education? No.

Are we to feel sorry for these men who benefit from union membership, earning salaries placing them well into the middle class. As union members they receive mostly paid up health insurance, pension, and savings plans, now and when they retire, something only a tiny number of American workers receive. All the evidence is that immigration creates jobs not cost jobs. Trump is more likely to diminish union influence than protect or enhance it, so how is that support better lives for workers. Wake up.

Trump has no idea what actions to take to improve them these brothers' lives. He's never struggled. Will Trump force companies who receive tax benefits to create additional new jobs from their profits? Don't kid me.

Finally, this attitude,"I'll buy American products until I have to pay more", is a free riding and dependency attitude of "let someone else do the heavy lifting", affirming to companies they are smart to produce consumer goods abroad. Trump peddled patent medicine and the brothers bought the con.
The teacher deserves more, not the other way around.
Maryland and Connecticut go back and forth for the highest incomes in the USA and Massachusetts and New Jersey aren't far behind.
In situations like this voting for Trump only makes sense if racism is the real reason. Few will admit it, but what other explanation makes sense?
Dear Brandon, keep dreaming, and believe in what set another expression make a great America great again… Something like that… Suckers!,

At first, I instinctively agree with you, Anne. But then....in the last paragraph, Brandon is clearly making the intellectual assessment that you're asking for. I think that when we, on the anti-Tramp side, denigrate the people who voted for him, it will inevitably make them angry and less willing to see the other side of the story. And that side of the story is that his own businesses use cheap immigrant labour and buy heavily from abroad. (Probably including tape measures!) I think you and I need to show more respect to the Brandons. He, and others like him, may not have degrees but they are much more savvy than we realise and voted the way they did because they were hurting. The same thing exactly happened here in the UK. Many Brandons shot themselves in the foot by voting for Brexit but it's easy to see why they did it if you look closely. And isn't that what you want Brandon to do?

So a billionaire potus is maybe better quality than a non-billionaire one, and a billionaire sec. of edu. is better quality than a..., etc.
Hmmm, quality....
You pay..., for what you get (oh boy, do you pay!) but you don't always get what you pay for.
I would argue that it's not that the factory workers are being paid too much but, rather, teachers are being paid way too little for their most important work.
You are completely missing one of the article's main points. Tariffs can and will cost jobs as well as create them, along with raising prices. A tariff system is in no way a panacea to our problems.

Voters remorse will set In quickly, here and elsewhere.   Once the outrageous promises and posturing by Trump and minions fails to produce anything but angst, then 2018 will be a turning point.   And those most disappointed will tend not to vote  R for a long while.  Count on this.  The D just need to run a credible and likeable candidate that is a 'regular' person.

I am so sad to say I had the same thought. With America growing more obese and less educated.....who will serve in our armed forces? Who will solve crime? Who will invent technology to keep us safe? Who will innovate products and solutions that will employ us? Who will care for us as we get sick? IMMIGRANTS.

This whole debate revolves around 2 things. First, do we impose import tariffs to protect US jobs but then at the same time make US consumers pay for those jobs and risk the prospect of a trade war? This is a difficult calculus to make, and may involve the US leaving the WTO to get this put in place. Be assured as well, as economic theory shows, owners of US firms selling domestically will also benefit, as profit margins can expand, but don't expect that to be reflected in pay packets.

That is, unless there are significant numbers of illegal immigrants working in a particular sector. In this case, when Trump's new policies on immigration really start to bite, then US wages will increase. This will likely affect areas like meat, fruit, construction etc, and will also cause the cost of these things to increase.

So, the second factor is how much more we are all willing to pay for items in order to protect US jobs? Obviously Trump supporters think that paying 10 or 15% more for products is worth it. But as in this article we have to acknowledge the downside here - who gains, who pays and the international consequences.

Don't forget about the Walmart factor of pushing their vendors to constsntly reduce prices forcing them to move products off shore.  Go to a Walmart store now and you won't find anything made in America.

The son does weight training for football. How many Indian software engineers spend their out of school time playing football? Perhaps the son should spend more time on STEM courses and learn to code. The world has changed and whining about the past won't change the future. Trump can't hold back the tide of change. Wake up Indiana

That is right, there are new plants, relocation of plants and expansions in the car industry but they are not happening in the union rust belt, they are in the right to work states of the soutb and west.

I support Unions and everything they protect, but manufactures dont and so locate in right to work states where there is less chance of unionizing. Not good for the Indiana brothers if there are factory jobs but they are located in SC like Boeing, Tennessee like Volkswagen, Nissan and Ford or other southern and western states. You know DT xoes not pay union wages or even American wages

But there will be fewer workers, that is the price if automation and robots can do these jobs. Still will not supply high paying jobs to high school graduates wanting to make 85,000 a year. That is gone the way oc robots, right to work anx wage compression

Not really true, the elite did not bust unions, that was Regan, most right to work states are Republican, the elite are no less interested in the stock holder over the wotket, the elite did not cause wage compression, that is Republicans arguing against raising the minimum wage. Democrats supported NAFTA but so did Republicans. The elite did not hurt the rust belt, and getting rid of trade will not help it.

I have two thoughts from reading this article.
1. I have at least four pairs of scissors, all made in CHINA, that do not cut a piece of paper. I could never find a pair made in AmeriKa.
2. Just this week, I returned from a trip to California to visit my son and daughter-in-law, who live in LA. We ended the trip by driving up the PCH to San Francisco. The PCH was closed from Point Ragged almost to Carmel, due to mudslides, so we detoured through the Salinas Valley. All we saw were oceans of acreage be harvested, prepared etc tended by.......immigrants. Maybe illegal? No American, pining for those jobs that left years ago is going to work in a field, planting and harvesting vegetables. None
Yes, as long as he keeps his promise to deport Mexicans. That vote for Trump was in part discriminatory
Would we buy a wholly American-made car for, say, $10,000-$15,000 more that was made by more-expensive American labor?

The Dems descending into new lows of rabid, childish temper-tantrum, desperately seeking to create the illusion that somehow Trump was some sort of Manchurian candidate. It's all part of an effort to oust president Trump. More evidence now that Obama ordered the wire-tapping of Trump Tower.
Speaking of collusion, it is quite clear that the Media, Democrats and members of the intelligence community have only one objective: destroy the Trump presidency at all cost. To hell with the business of the Nation or what's good for the American people. To hell with National security: witness all the classified leaks . . . It's about Power and nothing else.
Ironically, this intense collusion of the Media with the Dems did not yield a victory and even more ironic is that they try to blame their loss to some sort of Putin-Trump collusion that swayed the minds of the American voter. Laughable. Pelosi and Schumer acting like scorned children. And this is the leadership of the Dems? Political idiocy at its best. Thankfully, many Americans saw where the Dems were taking our Nation and what sort of transformation they seek for our nation which amounts to a lawless country with no borders, yes, a preface to the global community where the exceptionalism of America is offensive and must disappear . . such sense of liberal fairness.
You mean the "lawless country with no borders" where U.S. government officials perjure themselves during a Congressional hearing and the U.S. is now a Russian puppet state?

With the assistance of Russian hackers, a compromised head of the FBI,
a long standing series of Hillary-the-witch hunts (on the taxpayers dime) with a well funded and orchestrated negative propaganda campaign against Hillary the candidate for President, you manage to put into power a pathological narcissist with a long history of business failure and financial associations with the Russian mob. IMO the Republican party is in a serious credibility crisis.

Boy I tell ya, if this is how hateful pseudo genius Bannon runs a campaign, then transition and a White House's first few months, Trump would have been better off with a copy of Becoming President of the United States For Dummies.

Or should I say, The Art Of Becoming President of the United States For Dummies?
And yet you're still reading it.  'Bye.

In reply to JeffW;
If Sen. Burr will not do the work of the committee, he should resign as chairman.
